content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 1 to node 2 is:


```
1->3->4
```
Because node 3 is the intermediate node on the path between nodes 1 and 2. You can ignore node 5, as it doesn't connect directly to node 2. In other words, you go from node 1 to node 3, then to node 4.

However, if you were to start from node 7 (instead of node 1) and you wanted to reach node 2, the shortest path would be:


```makefile
7->3->4
```
You would have to follow the same steps: start from node 7, go to node 3, then to node 4. You don't have to include any of the nodes along the way (except for the destination), which makes this shortest path extremely short.

The shortest path from node 1 to node 3 is:


```makefile
1->3
```
You go directly from node 1 to node 3, without going through any other nodes.
